item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson warns of Europe 'second wave' amid Spain row
item.description: Boris Johnson says it is up to individuals to decide where to travel as he hints at further restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus: German officials 'very concerned' by rising cases
item.description: The head of Germany's public health agency says people have been "negligent" as infections increase.

item.title: Madeleine McCann investigators search German allotment
item.description: Police investigating the disappearance of Madeleine McCann search an allotment in Hanover.

item.title: Coronavirus: Spain travel row and a local lockdown
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Tuesday evening.

item.title: Virgin Galactic set for last key rocket test flights
item.description: Sir Richard Branson's tourist spaceplane company updates on progress, unveiling a cabin design.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr suspended from tweeting after Covid post
item.description: US president's son's use of Twitter is limited for 12 hours after he broke its misinformation rules.

item.title: Oldham coronavirus infection spike prompts new measures
item.description: The council is urging residents to follow extra precautions to avoid a "strict local lockdown".

item.title: Johnny Depp case: Lawyer says the Sun's story was 'not researched at all'
item.description: The paper did not properly check claims that Johnny Depp beat his wife, his lawyer tells a libel case.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2020: Watchmen leads the way with 26 nominations
item.description: The Marvellous Mrs Maisel, Ozark and Succession are also heavily nominated at this year's ceremony.

item.title: Wiley: Rapper deleted from Facebook and Instagram after abuse of Jewish critics
item.description: The grime artist posted inflammatory comments amid criticism over his previous anti-Semitic rant.

item.title: Bristol man hit by car in 'racist attack lucky to be alive'
item.description: The man was injured in "a deliberate act" which "could have resulted in a fatality", police say.

item.title: HS2: Seven women deny charges over tree protest in Buckinghamshire
item.description: The seven women told a court the 200-year-old oak tree is home to many species and needs protecting.

item.title: National Trust joins victims of Blackbaud hack
item.description: The charity says a database containing details of its volunteers and fundraisers has been affected.

item.title: PMDD: Thousands of women share their experiences
item.description: PMDD is an extreme form of premenstrual syndrome and commonly misdiagnosed.

item.title: Brand-new Merseyrail train covered in graffiti before delivery
item.description: Merseyrail will have to spend "thousands of pounds" cleaning the paint off, a spokesman says.

item.title: Van Gogh: Postcard helps experts 'find location of final masterpiece'
item.description: A postcard helped researchers pinpoint the probable spot near the French village of Auvers-sur-Oise.

item.title: Cocoa Girl: 'We made the first UK black girls' magazine'
item.description: Serlina Boyd created Cocoa Girl after finding nothing on the market aimed at her daughter's age group.

item.title: Suffolk villagers club together to buy dog a wheelchair
item.description: Spaniel Max can enjoy going on walkies again after losing the use of his back legs.

item.title: Living through lockdown when the love of your life is in a care home
item.description: Margaret was "devastated" when lockdown rules meant she couldn't visit her husband of 63 years in his care home.

item.title: Drake overtakes Madonna and The Beatles to break US Billboard chart record
item.description: The Canadian star has now had more Billboard Top 10 singles than any other artist.

item.title: Recordings show lockdown London quieter than 1928
item.description: Museum records London's "silent streets" of 2020 and reveals much noisier streets of 1928.

item.title: Booker Prize 2020: Hilary Mantel makes longlist
item.description: Thirteen novels have made the longlist, which will be whittled down to six in September.

item.title: Google's new transatlantic data cable to land in Cornwall
item.description: The tech giant plans a new high-end transatlantic data cable to go from the US to Bude, in Cornwall.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'We’re still waiting at home for them to come back'
item.description: Latinos represent 18% of the total US population but more than a third of Covid-19 cases.

item.title: The assistant headteachers aiming to increase BAME representation
item.description: Aretha and Youlande set up Mindful Equity UK to tackle the lack of BAME teachers in leadership roles.

item.title: Coronavirus: When home is both prison and sanctuary
item.description: Photographer Jo De Banzie records life during the coronavirus lockdown, using an antique camera.

item.title: AJ Tracey: 'There's no massive machine pushing me'
item.description: The rapper talks about missing live music, the Black Lives Matter movement and Tottenham's season.

item.title: Daisy the St Bernard dog back home after Scafell Pike mountain rescue
item.description: Daisy has made a full recovery after collapsing on Scafell Pike, England's highest mountain.

item.title: Fortnite's British teenage millionaire: One year later
item.description: Jaden ‘Wolfiez’ Ashman from Essex is the youngest esports player ever to win a million dollars.

item.title: Coronavirus in Wuhan: The son who lost his father to Covid-19
item.description: Zhang Hai travelled to the city with his father for routine surgery just before it went into lockdown.

item.title: Northamptonshire tornado throws up trail of debris
item.description: Rubbish twirling through the air is captured on video as a tornado spins through open countryside.

item.title: Will a £50 bike repair voucher get Wellingborough cycling?
item.description: Can a government cycling initiative work in the town where people cycle the least?

item.title: ‘Don’t come back, they’ll kill you for being gay’
item.description: When Mohamed was caught with his boyfriend he had to flee Somaliland, where homosexuality is illegal.

item.title: How can I protect my bike?
item.description: As the government encourages people to get on their bikes, what do novices need to know?

item.title: Obesity: Have 20 years of policies had any effect?
item.description: There's been two decades of efforts to tackle obesity. Has anything worked?

item.title: Indian Matchmaking: The 'cringe-worthy' Netflix show that is a huge hit
item.description: Indian Matchmaking, a new Netflix show, has become a huge hit, spawning hundreds of memes and jokes.

item.title: Training your brain to relax on a virtual island
item.description: A headset that can measure your brain's reaction to images could improve mental health.

item.title: Russell Crowe: Unhinged role reflects on 'rage in Western society'
item.description: The actor says his new road rage thriller taps into a wider anger in Western society.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can this California prison save itself from Covid-19?
item.description: San Quentin is battling a devastating coronavirus outbreak that critics say could have been avoided.

item.title: Johnny Depp case: What are the libel laws and how do they work?
item.description: Actor Johnny Depp is taking legal action against the publisher of the Sun newspaper over an online article.

item.title: Coronavirus: Lewis Hamilton deletes vaccine conspiracy theory post
item.description: The Formula 1 champion has been criticised for sharing a video appearing to criticise Bill Gates.

item.title: Coronavirus: What went wrong in Scotland's care homes?
item.description: Why did more people die with Covid-19 in Scotland's care homes than in its hospitals?

item.title: Coronavirus: How bad will winter really be?
item.description: Could we be heading for a double whammy of flu and coronavirus?

item.title: The millions 'hanging by a thread' as coronavirus aid expires
item.description: A $600 boost to unemployment benefit is set to expire soon, leaving many people worried about money.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vietnam coma pilot warns people 'not to be blasé'
item.description: Scot Stephen Cameron spent more than two months in a coma in Vietnam after contracting coronavirus.

item.title: England complete big win to beat West Indies and lift Wisden Trophy
item.description: Stuart Broad's 500th Test wicket sends England on the way to completing a series victory over West Indies on the final day of the third Test at Emirates Old Trafford.

item.title: Man City showed Uefa 'blatant disregard' in FFP case
item.description: Man City showed a "blatant disregard" to co-operate during Uefa's investigation into whether they broke FFP rules, says Cas.

item.title: Stuart Broad: Chris Broad, Alastair Cook & Michael Vaughan on England's 500-wicket bowler
item.description: Nottingham Forest fan, wannabe rapper and terrible golf chipper, this is Stuart Broad by those who know him best.

item.title: Tinkler critical of British Gymnastics over time taken to investigate complaint
item.description: Olympic medallist Amy Tinkler criticises British Gymnastics for the time it has taken to investigate her formal complaint.

item.title: Battle of the Brits Team Tennis: Johanna Konta digs deep to beat Katie Boulter
item.description: British number one Johanna Konta digs deep to earn her first win at the Battle of the Brits team event, while Dan Evans beats Kyle Edmund.

item.title: I was lost as a player and person - Lingard
item.description: Manchester United midfielder Jesse Lingard says he was "lost as a player and person" during a difficult season.

item.title: Battle of the Brits tennis: Best shots as Johanna Konta beats Katie Boulter
item.description: Watch the best shots as British number one Johanna Konta earns her first win at the Battle of the Brits team event with an impressive comeback against Katie Boulter.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: When I come back from Spain, will I get paid if I self-isolate?
item.description: The 14-day quarantine on travellers arriving from Spain has caused "uncertainty and confusion".

item.title: Coronavirus: Why isn't the UK testing travellers on arrival?
item.description: Some countries offer a choice - get tested or go into quarantine. Should the UK?

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I use the 'eat out to help out scheme'?
item.description: Thousands of venues will take part in a discounting scheme to help boost the hospitality industry.

item.title: Step-by-step guide to making your own face mask
item.description: Our guide to different types of face coverings and step-by-step instructions on how to make them.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New agreements mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: Might it have side-effects?
item.description: Questions about how a vaccine might work and other coronavirus topics.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: What do you need to know if you're planning to fly during the Covid-19 pandemic?

item.title: Coronavirus: What powers do the police have?
item.description: Coronavirus lockdown rules are changing across the UK, but who is responsible for enforcing them?

item.title: Coronavirus: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: False and misleading claims about vaccines debunked
item.description: Misinformation about coronavirus vaccine trials has been spreading on social media.

item.title: Coronavirus: How are indoor gyms and pools going to open?
item.description: As lockdown eases in England, more activities are being allowed but how are customers being kept safe?

item.title: Working from home: How to cut your tax bill
item.description: Home workers can claim tax allowances for their lighting, heating and other expenses.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?
item.description: England will follow Scotland by making face coverings compulsory in shops.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: About 200 groups of medical researchers around the world are working on a vaccine for Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Deadly masks' claims debunked
item.description: The BBC's anti-disinformation team has been investigating misleading health claims about wearing face coverings.

item.title: How not to wear a face mask
item.description: New rules mean face coverings are now mandatory in England in all shops.

item.title: What is redundancy, who can be made redundant and what are my rights?
item.description: As thousands of job losses owing to coronavirus are announced, here is a guide to your financial entitlements.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Coronavirus: A user's guide to wearing a face mask to the shops
item.description: From stopping your glasses fogging up to washing techniques, here's what you need to know.

item.title: How to stop your glasses steaming up with a face mask on
item.description: Three simple tips to stop your glasses fogging up while you shop with a mask or face covering on.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the care home visiting rules in England?
item.description: New guidance gives hope to relatives wanting to visit care homes.

item.title: Coronavirus: Where can I go on holiday? A guide to destinations
item.description: As people in the UK get the green light to go abroad again, here's a look at what's in store for travellers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Young people on benefits double in lockdown
item.description: Experts fear it may take up to four years for youth unemployment to recover from the pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus: What closes in a local lockdown?
item.description: Local authorities will be given the power to take action on coronavirus outbreaks in their area.

item.title: Does getting coronavirus make you immune?
item.description: What you need to know about how the immune system works.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Social distancing and lockdown rules are changing in England - but what can you now do?

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: People are being asked to return to work, meaning public transport could become more crowded.

item.title: The dying teenager who wanted world peace (and love)
item.description: An American teen with cancer went to Moscow in 1988 hoping to meet Gorbachev and rid the world of nukes.
